pull.title: ci: label docker images and prune dangling images selectively
pull.body:
Follow-up from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27777#discussion_r1210209382.

Labeling the docker images produced by the CI allows us/the user to apply batch operations to all images (including dangling ones) produced by the ci without affecting other, non-bitcoin-ci images. With labeling, we can safely always prune dangling bitcoin-ci-test images without checking for `RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN`, which we enable on our persistent runners.

### Conflicts

Concept ACK. Haven't tested.

It would also be nice to have an incantation (e.g. in the help) to kill dangling images after CI failure / interruption (if you don't plan on running it again).

Rebased to address merge conflict from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27844.

> It would also be nice to have an incantation (e.g. in the help) to kill dangling images after CI failure / interruption (if you don't plan on running it again).

Thanks, added [doc: ci: add instructions for pruning dangling images manually](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27793/commits/f9b5fe40cdaab04a1bf72699f1eb4be44ab24bbe)
Rebased to address merge conflict from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28138.
Rebased to address merge conflict from https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28161.
Force pushed to update documentation [addressing this review comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27793#discussion_r1293632896).
Could rebase for green CI, if still relevant?
Rebased to address merge conflict from #27976.

Concept ACK.

Perhaps description needs to be updated regarding the user instructions (`ci/README.md`).

> Perhaps description needs to be updated regarding the user instructions (`ci/README.md`).

Thanks, reverted that description.
Closed, not an essential change and doesn't seem like there's sufficient interest.

verification.payload:
tree f7ff97a590a329a4ed4980c7caafaba2d11b6407
parent 73dfa6da0801e3116e7e84cd5e089b98a9f70212
author stickies-v <stickies-v@protonmail.com> 1685529255 +0100
committer stickies-v <stickies-v@protonmail.com> 1697188641 +0100

ci: add label to docker images

This allows us or the user to perform batch operations on all
images produced by the ci, e.g. to prune all dangling images,
without affecting non-ci images.

events.message:
ci: add label to docker images

This allows us or the user to perform batch operations on all
images produced by the ci, e.g. to prune all dangling images,
without affecting non-ci images.

verification.payload:
tree 0d454ff9f6d079ff0e67b62533f9ee89d5f2b40d
parent ce1699706e98201db73209ee495051359b1d0703
author stickies-v <stickies-v@protonmail.com> 1685529345 +0100
committer stickies-v <stickies-v@protonmail.com> 1697192610 +0100

ci: always prune all dangling bitcoin-ci-test images

Since all bitcoin-ci-test images are now labeled, we can always
prune all dangling images, regardless of whether we are in
RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN.

To be safe, still prune all images if RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN
in case the filtering doesn't work, or if images were created on
an earlier version that did not assign labels.

events.message:
ci: always prune all dangling bitcoin-ci-test images

Since all bitcoin-ci-test images are now labeled, we can always
prune all dangling images, regardless of whether we are in
RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN.

To be safe, still prune all images if RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN
in case the filtering doesn't work, or if images were created on
an earlier version that did not assign labels.

events.body: Force-pushed to address merge conflict from #28547 and incorporate [suggestion](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27793#discussion_r1357995285) from maflcko to keep the unfiltered pruning for now, as belt and suspenders approach.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -26,6 +26,13 @@ To run the test stage with a specific configuration,
 FILE_ENV="./ci/test/00_setup_env_arm.sh" ./ci/test_run_all.sh
 ```
 
+The ci automatically prunes all dangling docker images every time it runs. If you want to perform
+the cleanup manually (e.g. if you won't be running the ci again), you can run
+
+```sh
+docker image prune --force --filter "label=bitcoin-ci-test"
comments.body: I think if one wants to not run the CI again, they'll need to use `rm` instead of `prune`, no? The goal of prune is to only remove dangling/stale/intermediate image layers?

comments.body:
Yeah, would you prefer it like this?

````diff
diff --git a/ci/README.md b/ci/README.md
index ab5e6ce866..16310b7703 100644
--- a/ci/README.md
+++ b/ci/README.md
@@ -26,13 +26,19 @@ To run the test stage with a specific configuration,
 FILE_ENV="./ci/test/00_setup_env_arm.sh" ./ci/test_run_all.sh
 ```
 
-The ci automatically prunes all dangling docker images every time it runs. If you want to perform
-the cleanup manually (e.g. if you won't be running the ci again), you can run
+The ci automatically prunes all dangling (i.e. unused) docker images every time it runs. To do this
+manually, run
 
 ```sh
 docker image prune --force --filter "label=bitcoin-ci-test"
 ```
 
+To also remove the used images (e.g. if you're not planning on running the ci again), run
+
+```sh
+docker rmi -f $(docker images -q -a --filter "label=bitcoin-ci-test")
+```
+
 ### Configurations
 
 The test files (`FILE_ENV`) are constructed to test a wide range of

````

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -26,9 +28,9 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
   if [ -n "${RESTART_CI_DOCKER_BEFORE_RUN}" ] ; then
     echo "Restart docker before run to stop and clear all containers started with --rm"
     podman container stop --all  # Similar to "systemctl restart docker"
-    echo "Prune all dangling images"
-    docker image prune --force
comments.body: Maybe keep this, just to be safe, in case the label stuff doesn't work? (For example from a previous run when labels weren't set) :sweat_smile:

     podman container stop --all  # Similar to "systemctl restart docker"
-    echo "Prune all dangling images"

comments.body: Makes sense, especially the migration aspect which I didn't think about. Added a comment that it can probably be removed in the future, though.
